Package io

Class IO

java.lang.Object
io.IO
Direct Known Subclasses:
BuyIO, PortIO, RepairIO, SailToIO, SellIO, StoreIO, TransactionQuantityIO, UpgradeIO
public abstract class IO
extends java.lang.Object
The IO (input and output) is an abstract class for creating command line interface. It is the base for PortIO, SailToIO, RepairIO, UpgradeIO, StoreIO, BuyIO, and TransactionQuantityIO.

The sub-classes created based on IO print prompts for different commands, take integers inputs from users, validate the inputs, and pass the inputs as an ArrayList to CommandHandler through GameEnvironment.

Author:
Finn van Dorsser, Meng Zhang

  • Method Details

    • readCommandArguments

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> readCommandArguments​(java.lang.String prompt)
      This method prints the prompt and available command options returned by getCommandsListString(), gets an input of integer from users, and validates the input. If the input is valid, this method will add the command matching the input to attribute commandArguments. If the input is invalid, this method will print an error message.

      If attribute gettingTransactionQuantity is true, any positive integer input will be acceptable. Otherwise, only integer inputs matching available commands in attribute commandsList are accepted.

      Parameters:
      prompt - the string prompt for this interface IO object
      Returns:
      the ArrayList of commandArguments

    • processPlayerInput

      public abstract void processPlayerInput​(int choice)
      This is an abstract method which processes a command input from users.
      Parameters:
      choice - an integer which matches a command in this interface

    • setGettingTransactionQuantity

      public void setGettingTransactionQuantity​(boolean value)
      This method is the setter for attribute gettingTransactionQuantity.
      Parameters:
      value - true if the interface object accepts all natural numbers as input, otherwise false

    • addCommand

      public void addCommand​(java.lang.String command)

    • getCommandsListString

      public java.lang.String getCommandsListString()
      This method iterates attribute commandsList and concatenates all the commands into a string.
      Returns:
      a formated string which includes all the command options
